description: TikTok content creator Tiffany Cianci is doing all she can to persuade President-elect Donald Trump to save the popular social media app, which the government calls a national security risk.
title: TikTokers Put Hope in Online Campaign to Get Trump to End US Ban

description: Rudolph Giuliani was held in contempt for the second time in one week after a federal judge found he violated an order to stop defaming two 2020 presidential election poll workers.
title: Giuliani Hit With Second Contempt of Court Ruling in a Week

description: Former central banker Mark Carney is poised to announce that he’s jumping into the race to succeed Justin Trudeau as leader of the Liberal Party and Canadian prime minister.
title: Carney to Enter Race to Replace Trudeau as Canada Prime Minister

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Inherits a Solid Economy After Setting Big Expectations

description: The uneasy truce between the nuclear-armed North and the US-allied South remains one of the most vexing security concerns for the world.
title: Understanding the Forever Conflict Between North and South Korea

description: The Trump Organization submitted an ethics plan for Donald J. Trump’s second presidential term that doesn’t rule out striking new deals with foreign companies — a break with its approach to managing conflicts of interest when he first took office.
title: Trump Organization’s Ethics Plan Loosens Curbs on Foreign Deals

description: Mark Zuckerberg criticized the Biden administration during a conversation with podcaster Joe Rogan, claiming the administration would “scream” and “curse” at Meta Platforms Inc. employees amid discussions about how to moderate content related to Covid-19 during the pandemic.
title: Mark Zuckerberg Slams Biden Administration on Joe Rogan’s Podcast

description: The US is moving to curb imports of used cooking oil, preventing foreign supplies used to make biofuels from qualifying for a lucrative tax credit.
title: US Moves to Curb Some Cooking Oil Imports With Green Fuel Rule

description: France’s finance minister Eric Lombard will present budget proposals to Prime Minister Francois Bayrou on Saturday after a week of negotiations with opposition parties to navigate deep divisions over public finances.
title: French Ministers to Present Budget Proposals to Bayrou Saturday

description: Two of seven US intelligence agencies broke with previous assessments that foreign adversaries were not to blame for so-far unexplained health incidents among government employees overseas that came to be known as “Havana Syndrome.”
title: US Intelligence Now Split on Possible ‘Havana Syndrome’ Cause

description: President Joe Biden’s administration extended temporary protected status for 600,000 Venezuelans and more than 200,000 Salvadorans in the US just 10 days before Donald Trump takes office vowing mass deportation of immigrants.
title: Biden Extends Protected Status for 800,000 Venezuelans, Salvadorans

description: Here are the key takeaways from today’s arguments in front of the US Supreme Court in the TikTok case:
title: Here Are the Key Takeaways From US Supreme Court’s Hearing on TikTok Ban

description: Greenland is looking to strengthen its economy and become more self-sustaining, according to the island’s Prime Minister Mute B. Egede, who is pushing for independence for the territory.
title: Greenland PM Seeks Boost to Economy Amid Independence Drive

description: The Trump Organization is in early talks to reacquire its former Washington hotel, which became a flash point for critics who said that Donald Trump mixed his business and political interests while president.
title: Trump Organization Eyes Buying Back Hotel That Drew Scrutiny

description: Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic called a US decision to sanction Naftna Industrija Srbije, the country’s sole refiner that’s controlled by Gazprom, very harsh and said “some kind of transaction” will be needed to ensure its functioning.
title: Serbia’s Vucic Calls US Sanctions on Its Sole Refiner Very Harsh

description: The US on Friday announced the most sweeping and aggressive sanctions yet on Russia’s oil trade, just ten days before Joe Biden leaves the White House to be replaced by Donald Trump as president.
title: Why Biden’s Farewell Sanctions on Russian Oil Are a Big Deal

description: The US on Friday ramped up pressure on Venezuela’s Nicolás Maduro and his regime, including raising a reward for his arrest on narcotics charges and new sanctions on officials in response to his contested election and crackdown on opposition.
title: US Raises Pressure on Venezuela’s Maduro as He Starts New Term

description: The US Treasury sanctioned Naftna Industrija Srbije, Serbia’s sole refiner that’s controlled by Gazprom, as part of a fresh package of sweeping measures targeting Russia energy producers.
title: US Sanctions Serbia’s Sole Refiner Controlled by Gazprom

description: The US imposed its most aggressive sanctions on Russia’s oil industry yet as the Biden administration looks for last-minute ways to boost Ukraine’s leverage in possible peace negotiations after Donald Trump takes office.
title: US Ramps Up Pressure on Russia With Fresh Energy Sanctions

description: Canadian Foreign Affairs Minister Melanie Joly said she won’t enter the leadership race to succeed Justin Trudeau as prime minister.
title: Canada Foreign Minister Joly Won’t Run to Replace Trudeau

description: Donald Trump, the first former US president convicted of a felony, was sentenced by a New York judge Friday to no jail or probation for his hush money case.
title: Trump Gets No Jail Time or Probation in NY Hush Money Case

description: A visitor takes a photograph of the Supreme Court in Washington, DC. Photographer: Stefani Reynolds/Bloomberg
title: US Supreme Court Weighs Arguments on TikTok Ban

description: Former US Senator Bob Menendez, the once-powerful New Jersey Democrat convicted of corruption charges, should spend 15 years in prison, US prosecutors said.
title: Bob Menendez Deserves 15 Years in Prison for Bribes, US Says

description: Keir Starmer will travel to Ukraine in the coming weeks to discuss the possibility of deploying an international peacekeeping force there after the conflict with Russia has ended, his first visit to the war-torn nation since becoming UK prime minister half a year ago.
title: Keir Starmer to Visit Ukraine to Discuss Postwar Peacekeeping Force

description: Slovakian Prime Minister Robert Fico said Russia will if necessary deliver gas to cover the country’s domestic consumption this year, even as he seeks to restore fuel flows via Ukraine.
title: Slovakia’s Fico Says Russia Has Committed to Delivering Gas

description: Norway plans to require all new buildings to have a bomb shelter as part of its efforts to boost crisis resilience of its civil society after neighboring Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.
title: Norway to Mandate Bomb Shelters in New Civil Defense Plan

description: The UK government said compensating victims of child grooming gangs in a decades-old scandal is a “complex” issue that needs to be examined closely before further action is taken.
title: UK Says Compensation for Rape Gang Victims Is ‘Complex’ Issue

description: Romanians took to the streets on Friday in support of fringe pro-Russian candidate Calin Georgescu, demanding the country’s top court reverse its decision to cancel a presidential ballot in which he was a frontrunner.
title: Thousands Protest in Romania to Support Pro-Russian Candidate

description: With his challengers scattered and reeling, Venezuela’s Nicolás Maduro is set to be sworn in for a third six-year term on Friday, shrugging off international condemnation of a sham election and a brutal crackdown on dissent.
title: Maduro Cements Power in Venezuela as Opposition Grasps for Hope

description: Turkey’s President Recep Tayyip Erdogan will extend the country’s Gaza war-related boycott of the World Economic Forum in Davos for another year, with top economic officials set to skip this month’s gathering.
title: Turkey Set to Boycott Davos For Second Year Over War in Gaza

description: Britain’s Labour government may have to ditch its manifesto promise not to raise taxes on working people if market interest rates rise much further, according to former Bank of England rate-setter Martin Weale.
title: Reeves May Have to Scrap Tax Pledge, Says Ex-Bank of England Official

description: NATO is increasing its surveillance operations in the Baltic Sea region with two ships deployed to the area following suspected sabotage of undersea cables between Finland and Estonia.
title: NATO to Deploy Two Ships to Guard Baltic Sea Infrastructure

description: President-elect Trump is on track for a main cabinet that has more than double the number of women he had eight years ago.
title: Trump's Second-Term Cabinet Is More Diverse Than His First

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Venezuela Showdown Threatens as Maduro Tightens His Grip

description: Canada is drawing up plans for extensive tariffs against US products if Donald Trump follows through on his threat to put 25% levies on Canadian goods, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Canada Plots Broad Tariff Retaliation If Trump Starts Trade War

description: The European Union is set to warn that the integration of the bloc’s single market is slowing down at the same time it’s facing stiffening pressure from major global economies including the US and China, according to a draft report seen by Bloomberg.
title: EU Set to Back Draghi Warnings on Lagging Behind US and China

description: UK assets have suffered a horrendous start to the new year as investors fret about the country’s finances, reigniting memories of a market crisis in 2022 that brought down former Prime Minister Liz Truss.
title: The UK’s Horrible Start to the Year in Six Charts on Markets

description: The future of the wildly popular social media platform TikTok rides on a US Supreme Court clash that pits national security against free speech – and one president against another.
title: TikTok Supreme Court Clash Pits Free Speech Against US Security

description: Taiwan is considering buying more energy from the US to fulfill the rising needs of its industries, the latest government searching for ways to boost ties and potentially head off the threat of President-elect Donald Trump’s proposed tariffs.
title: Chipmaking Hub Taiwan Mulls Buying More Energy from the US

description: For Narendra Modi, the Maha Kumbh Mela is a unique opportunity to double down on religiosity in government.
title: The World’s Largest Pilgrimage Is a Stage for India’s Hindu Right

description: Argentines are turning more optimistic about the future of their nation’s beleaguered economy, a shift that stands to embolden austerity-minded President Javier Milei ahead of midterm elections later this year.
title: Argentines Are Increasingly Positive About the Milei Economy

description: Chile Interior Minister Carolina Toha is the current favorite among potential center-left contenders in this year’s presidential election, an early poll showed, as tensions mount over which candidates the coalition will put forth in the coming months.
title: Chile Crime Fighter Emerges as Left-Wing’s Presidential Favorite

description: Disapproval of Brazil’s Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva reached the highest level of his term in December on growing frustration with the leftist president’s economic stewardship.
title: Lula Disapproval Hits New High With Brazilians Pessimistic About Economy

description: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum’s approval rating slipped roughly 100 days into her administration as voters clamor for stronger action against crime and corruption, according to a new poll.
title: Sheinbaum’s Support Slips as Mexicans Decry Crime and Corruption

description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol’s security chief resigned Friday, a week after leading a team that blocked an attempt to arrest the impeached president over his short-lived imposition of martial law.
title: President Yoon’s Security Chief Quits as New Arrest Bid Looms

description: A two-story clock in the Lithuanian capital is tracking the minutes until the countries switch to Europe’s electricity system.
title: Baltics Count Down the Days to Leaving Russian Energy Grid

description: Turkish central bank officials will step up meetings with local business leaders this year, seeking to improve policy communication at the start of what’s expected to be a lengthy interest-rate cutting cycle.
title: Turkish Central Bank to Court Local Firms to Convey Policy Ideas

description: Borrowing costs have risen, pound has declined to lowest in more than a year
title: UK Bond Selloff Puts Reeves’ Economic Project on the Brink

description: Donald Trump’s obsession with Greenland has put the world’s largest island in an unexpected position of power.
title: Greenland Eyes Benefits in Trump’s Proposed Land Grab

description: Around half a million members of an influential Philippine religious group are set to hold a rally in the capital on Monday, police said, to oppose moves in Congress to impeach Vice President Sara Duterte.
title: Mega Church Plans Rally to Support Duterte in Philippines Feud

description: The support rate for South Korea’s main opposition that has been leading the impeachment campaign against President Yoon Suk Yeol dived, as investigators struggle to arrest the embattled leader.
title: South Korean Opposition’s Support Slides as Yoon Defies Arrest

description: President-elect Donald Trump said a meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin is being set up.
title: Donald Trump Says Meeting With Putin Is Being Arranged

description: A federal appeals court won’t block Attorney General Merrick Garland from releasing a special counsel’s report detailing the findings of his criminal investigations into President-elect Donald Trump.
title: Trump Special Counsel Report Release Left in Limbo by Court

description: Vice President Kamala Harris is canceling a three-nation overseas trip to remain in the US and assist in the federal response to the catastrophic wildfires in her home state of California.
title: Harris Cancels Overseas Trip to Focus on Wildfire Response

description: The US Supreme Court cleared the way for President-elect Donald Trump’s sentencing in his hush money criminal case, dealing him a symbolic setback as he prepares to begin his second term in office.
title: Supreme Court Allows Trump’s Sentencing in NY Hush Money Case
